snippet: Plaintiffs challenging a Wisconsin law offer strong evidence of racially discriminatory effects.
abstract: Editorial contends verdict in a federal trial on Wisconsin's 2011 voter ID law will help define the future of the Voting Rights Act, which has been in question since Supreme Court gutted Section 5 of the law; maintains that the underlying purpose of such laws requiring voters to show identification is to prevent eligible people from voting.
lead_paragraph: Plaintiffs challenging a Wisconsin law offer strong evidence of racially discriminatory effects.

headline.main: Voter ID Gets Another Day in Court
headline.print_headline: Voter ID Gets Another Day in Court
